makers.displaydate: 1893–1967; born Ashtabula Harbor, OH; died West Seneca, NY
makers.displaymaker: Charles Ephraim Burchfield, 1893–1967; born Ashtabula Harbor, OH; died West Seneca, NY

texts.textentryhtml: This blustery overcast landscape captures the rural setting of Gardenville, New York (near Buffalo), where Burchfield spent most of his career after 1925. There he deepened his spiritual relationship with nature, privileging significance over specificity of place by projecting internal states onto his surroundings. Aptly described as one of the most calligraphic of watercolorists, Burchfield here contrasts the dark and feather-like plumes of the tossing treetops on the horizon with the fuzzy white aureoles of milkweed in the foreground while anchoring the rhythmic sway of the fields with the angular lines of the farm buildings.;
texts.remarks: Paintings on Paper: American Watercolors at Princeton
